title.narrative: OTP 1: CHILDREN S RIGHT TO PROTECTION

description.narrative: By 2017, the Government addresses disparities in access to quality education, health, protection and justice services for disadvantaged children and families, which contributes to Child Protection Systems, Child Protection â€“ Strengthen Families And Communities, Human Rights Institutions, Justice For Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2017, the Government addresses disparities in access to quality education, health, protection and justice services for disadvantaged children and families.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2017, the Government addresses disparities in access to quality education, health, protection and justice services fordisadvantaged children and families

description.narrative: Further decrease with 50 per cent of children in institutional care was achieved in UNICEF supported project areas in 2017. Approximately half a million people in Moldova were reached with messages promoting foster care. More than 2,000 children benefited from qualified legal assistance in criminal and non-criminal cases. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:12/01/2018

title.narrative: Proportion of children reintegrated into their biological/extended family out of cases presented to guardianship authorities

actual.value: 2017:(2016 data) 39.5% of children reintegrated in biological/extended family

title.narrative: Number of districts implementing the inter-sectoral referral mechanism on abuse, neglect, exploitation and trafficking

actual.value: 2017:All 35 districts implement the mechanism. The mechanism better functions in 18 districts where partners' support exist.

title.narrative: Percentage of parents using abusive forms to discipline their children (beating)

baseline.value: 41.5%, beating their children under 1 year of age 16.4%

target.value: 2017:30%, beating their children under 1 year of age 10%

title.narrative: Municipalities that implement local protocols for the protection of children from violence, abuse and neglect

actual.value: 2017:All 35 districts implement the mechanism. The mechanism better functions in 18 districts where partners' support exist.

title.narrative: Status of data collection system under the inter-sectoral mechanism on abuse, neglect, exploitation and trafficking against children

baseline.value: data collection tool (unified statistical form) developped, piloted and approved

target.value: 2017:data is collected nationwide (the fiche is applied in all districts and reports are generated)
